com.rcsexample.basnlib

Class Data

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rcsexample.basnlib.Data

  • public class Data
extends java.lang.Object
    Data is a class designed to transfer a set of data points from various sources in a standardized way. The class is used by the DataProvider class to transfer its data.

    The getters return ArrayLists of actual data points.

    Each data point has a Double for each dimension (X,Y,Z) and their respective time (T).

    Author:
    laurenz

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DATA_SOURCE_BLUETOOTH
      This Data originates from the Bluetooth sensor
      static int DATA_SOURCE_FILE
      This Data originates from a file with data points
      static int DATA_SOURCE_NONE
      There is no source (could be used for fake data)
      static int DATA_SOURCE_PHONE
      This Data originates from the phone sensor

    • Constructor Detail

      • Data

        public Data(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> mX,
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> mY,
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> mZ,
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> mT,
    int source)
        Constructor for the Data object. This is where the object gets its values. The timestamp should be in ms since epoch (sensor reset or unix epoch). Acceleration data should be in m/s^2.
        Parameters:
        mX - ArrayList of Doubles representing the data values in the X dimension
        mY - ArrayList of Doubles representing the data values in the Y dimension
        mZ - ArrayList of Doubles representing the data values in the Z dimension
        mT - ArrayList of Doubles representing the timestamps of the data values
        source - The data source. Should be one of DATA_SOURCE_PHONE, DATA_SOURCE_BLUETOOTH, DATA_SOURCE_FILE
